references.W14NAT01USGP: NatureServe. 2014. NatureServe Explorer: An online encyclopedia of life [web application]. Version 7.1. NatureServe, Arlington, Virginia. Available http://explorer.natureserve.org. (Accessed: February 21, 2014 ).

habitat_description:
Southwest:
In California, this species occurs from the Oregon border (Siskiyou and Modoc cos.) south to San Francisco Bay, and in the Sacramento Valley and Sierra Nevada foothills from El Dorado Co. north. Inhabits open areas, generally below 400 m (1310 ft) elevation, but found as high as 1300 m (4270 ft) in Shasta Co. Usually found in annual grassland habitat, but also occurs in clearings in mixed chaparral and hardwood-conifer habitats on the lower slopes of foothills,  (Verner and Boss 1980). Has also been associated with sage habitats (James et al. 1984, Stangl et al. 1999) (quoted directly from Brylski [CA WHR 1999] based on Zeiner et al. 1900). This is a burrowing species that prefers well-drained, loose and sandy soils at the base of shrubs or rock edges (NatureServe 2014, Zeiner et al. 1990).
